alert.note: Alert for Alpine (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 11:19AM PDT until May 25 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Nevada... East Fork Carson River Near Gardnerville affecting Douglas County. .Warm temperatures and snowmelt in the Sierra will continue to result in high flows along the West and East Forks of the Carson River. For the East Fork Carson River...including Gardnerville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flows near flood level caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...East Fork Carson River Near Gardnerville. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Lowest portions of Carson Valley begin to have flood threat. The most flood prone areas include the Washoe Tribe Reservation, Carson Valley Country Club, Glenwood Drive, Riverview Drive, Centerville Road, NV Hwy 88, Westwood Village, Rocky Slough, Dresslerville Road, Waterloo and Mottsville Lanes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 13.6 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The river will be quick moving and very cold. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon by 3 PM PDT.
